normalised: Environmental News: Mumbai Tackling its Mountains of Waste, Slowly But Surely!

unnormalised: Environmental News: Mumbai Tackling its Mountains of Waste, Slowly But Surely!
normalised: Hey everyone! Let's talk trash. Mumbai, our beloved city of dreams, generates a lot of waste every single day. Think mountains of discarded chai cups after the nine hundred hours office rush and leftover vada pavs. It's a challenge, right?

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Let's talk trash. Mumbai, our beloved city of dreams, generates a LOT of waste every single day. Think mountains of discarded chai cups after the 09:00 hrs office rush and leftover vada pavs. It's a challenge, right?
normalised: But hold on, there's good news! The B M C (Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation) is stepping up its game. They're pushing for better waste segregation at source – that means you separating your dry and wet waste at home! Plus, they're investing in waste-to-energy plants near Deonar and Mulund.

unnormalised: But hold on, there's good news! The BMC (Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation) is stepping up its game. They're pushing for better waste segregation at source – that means YOU separating your dry and wet waste at home! Plus, they're investing in waste-to-energy plants near Deonar and Mulund.
normalised: Remember that Swachh Bharat Abhiyan launch back on second October two thousand and fourteen? It's still inspiring change. The B M C also has plans to reduce landfill usage by twenty five percent by two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: Remember that Swachh Bharat Abhiyan launch back on 02/10/2014? It's still inspiring change. The BMC also has plans to reduce landfill usage by 25% by 2025.
normalised: Companies like Godrej are even running initiatives to educate citizens on composting. And some local N G O s are holding awareness camps - there's one scheduled for fifteenth August two thousand and twenty four, Independence Day! So, while we're celebrating freedom, let’s also remember to free our city from waste. Every little bit counts. Small changes from each of us can make a big difference! Let's do it, Mumbai!

unnormalised: Companies like Godrej are even running initiatives to educate citizens on composting. And some local NGOs are holding awareness camps - there's one scheduled for 15/08/2024, Independence Day! So, while we're celebrating freedom, let’s also remember to free our city from waste. Every little bit counts. Small changes from each of us can make a BIG difference! Let's do it, Mumbai!
